column2: MISSOURI DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.
column6: get off the road and check your tires.

column2: 2. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction
column6: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line
column8: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line
column10: Passing is not permitted in either direction

column2: 3. On two-lane, two-way streets or highways, you should start left turns:
column4: in the center of the lane.

column2: 4. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
5. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
6. A steady yellow light means that a ______ light will soon appear.
7. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: there is a right turn ahead.
column6: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.
column8: they must stay on the right side of the divider

column2: 8. This sign indicates:
9. This road sign means:
10. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column8: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column10: Wait for the next green light.

column2: 11. Diamond-shaped signs:
column6: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

column2: 12. This sign warns drivers that:
column8: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 13. This road sign indicates that:
column4: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.
column6: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column8: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.

column2: 14. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column8: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column2: 15. To drive defensively, you must:
column8: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.
column10: keep one hand on the steering wheel.

column2: 16. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
17. It is important for drivers to know that trucks:
column4: take longer than cars to stop.
column6: require less time to pass on an incline than cars.
column8: are easier for the driver to operate.
column10: require more space for turning movements.

column2: 18. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column10: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 19. This sign indicates:
20. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
21. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
22. Which shape is a yield sign?
23. If another car is in danger of hitting you, you should:
24. If your car breaks down on the highway, you should:
column4: sound your horn to warn passing vehicles.
column6: use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers.
column8: flash your headlights at oncoming traffic.
